de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.enablestate

Interface EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListAdapter<DataType>, MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateListAdapter, AbstractFilterableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateListAdapter, AbstractListAdapter, AbstractSelectableListAdapter, AbstractSortableListAdapter, ListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, which may be enabled or disabled, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • areAllItemsEnabled

        boolean areAllItemsEnabled()
        Returns, whether all items are currently enabled, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if all items are currently enabled, false otherwise

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(int index)
        Returns, whether the item, which belongs to a specific index, is currently enabled, or not.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose enable state should be checked, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the item, which belongs to the given index, is currently enabled, false otherwise

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(DataType item)
        Returns, whether a specific item is currently enabled, or not.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose enable state should be checked, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the given item is currently enabled, false otherwise

      • getFirstEnabledIndex

        int getFirstEnabledIndex()
        Returns the index of the first enabled item.
        Returns:
        The index of the first enabled item, as an Integer value or -1, if no item is currently enabled

      • getFirstEnabledItem

        DataType getFirstEnabledItem()
        Returns the first enabled item.
        Returns:
        The first enabled item, as an instance of the generic type DataType or null, if no item is currently enabled

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getEnabledIndices()
        Returns a list, which contains the indices of all currently enabled items.
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the indices of all currently enabled items, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if no item is currently enabled

      • getEnabledItems

        Returns a list, which contains all currently enabled items.
        Returns:
        A list, which contains all currently enabled items, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if no item is currently enabled

        Returns a list, which contains the indices of all currently disabled items.
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the indices of all currently disabled items, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if no item is currently disabled

      • getDisabledItems

        java.util.List<DataType> getDisabledItems()
        Returns a list, which contains all currently disabled items.
        Returns:
        A list, which contains all currently disabled items, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if no item is currently disabled

      • getEnabledItemCount

        int getEnabledItemCount()
        Returns the number of currently enabled items.
        Returns:
        The number of currently enabled items, as an Integer value

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(int index,
                boolean enabled)
        Sets the enable state of the item, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose enable state should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        enabled - True, if the item, which belongs to the given index, should be enabled, false otherwise

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(DataType item,
                boolean enabled)
        Sets the enable state of a specific item.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be enabled, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        enabled - True, if the given item should be enabled, false otherwise

      • triggerEnableState

        boolean triggerEnableState(int index)
        Triggers the enable state of the item, which belongs to a specific index. This causes the item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the item has been enabled, false, if the item has been disabled

      • triggerEnableState

        boolean triggerEnableState(DataType item)
        Triggers the enable state of a specific item. This causes the item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the item has been enabled, false, if the item has been disabled

      • setAllEnabled

        void setAllEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enable states of all items.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True, if all items should be enabled, false otherwise

      • triggerAllEnableStates

        void triggerAllEnableStates()
        Triggers the enable states of all items. This causes an item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.

      • addEnableStateListener

        void addEnableStateListener(ListEnableStateListener<DataType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type ListEnableStateListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeEnableStateListener

        void removeEnableStateListener(ListEnableStateListener<DataType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type ListEnableStateListener. The listener may not be null
